name: Dhaka-style Biriyani
description: A spicy and flavorful rice dish with tender meat and fragrant spices.
process: Marinate the meat with yogurt, spices, and aromatics.
Cook the rice with whole spices, fried onions, and saffron.
Layer the rice and meat in a pot and cook until tender and fragrant.
Garnish with fried onions, mint, and cilantro.

name: Shorshe Ilish
description: A traditional Bengali dish of Hilsa fish cooked in a mustard gravy.
process: Clean and marinate the fish with turmeric and salt.
Make a paste of mustard seeds, green chilies, and spices.
Fry the fish until golden brown and set aside.
Cook the mustard paste with onions, garlic, and turmeric.
Add water and cook until the gravy thickens.
Add the fried fish and simmer until cooked through.

name: Pitha
description: A sweet or savory rice cake popular in Bangladeshi cuisine.
process: Make a batter of rice flour, coconut milk, and sugar.
Shape the batter into small cakes and steam until cooked.
For savory pitha, add grated coconut, sesame seeds, and spices.
For sweet pitha, add jaggery, cardamom, and coconut.
